website_summaries.verdict: Whether on the go or enjoying an entire pot at home, this coffee maker provides both options without breaking the bank.
pros: Filter not needed for the single-cup side, as it includes a removable filter basket for ground coffee or soft coffee pods
Adjustable height on the single-serve size to accommodate cups and taller travel mugs
Can set timer for up to 24 hours ahead
cons: No permanent filter included on carafe side, so will need extra filters

customer_reviews.title: Slow brewing and tastes like plastic
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst coffee maker we have ever purchased. After a month, the coffee still has a plastic taste. The manufacturer has recommendations on running through vinegar to remove the taste, so it's obviously an ongoing problem. It didn't work. Why not solve the problem before the consumer gets the product instead of them having to deal with it. Also, it brews single serve cups painfully slowly. We bought a Keurig and went back to that. Never a funny after taste, even right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: The glass carafe broke near the handles on the first ...
customer_reviews.text: The glass carafe broke near the handles on the first brew without any coffee grounds used. Second use the sides of the glass where nothing is touching started cracking.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Chung

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: After 4 months the water line that feeds the hot water onto the coffee grounds clogged up. We emailed Hamilton Beach and were told we needed to “brew” a pot of vinegar through the coffee making cycle. We did and it worked for about a week. Now we’re constantly having to do the vinegar wash about twice/week or the coffee maker doesn’t make coffee. We have since learned from researching the internet that this problem is very common for this product. It’s apparently a design flaw. I would not recommend that anyone buy this model coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Carafe cracked after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: I loved the idea of kicking our Keurig to the curb and this seemed like an awesome deal! We ran water through it first to clear it out as suggested and then brewed a great pot of coffee using the carafe. On my 3rd time making a pot this morning the carafe cracked. I will not be purchasing another and Amazon had amazing customer service and is accepting my refund. I won't be purchasing another out of fear of the carafe possibly cracking or shattering.
customer_reviews.author: Heather G.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME Coffee Pot/ Great Price.. can't beat Amazon with this one...
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement coffee pot. The first one broke after several years. LOVE this coffee pot. Timer, brew strength, 12 cup carafe, Auto pause,clock and a single brew option. What more can you ask for? This SAME coffee pot was over $80 on other sites with coupons so I came to Amazon and bought it so much cheaper. Delivered on Labor day ( THANK YOU) The top piece where you put the water in is broken but it doesn't effect anything so I'm not complaining. I put a travel mug so you can see the size of a mug that will fit and brew. GREAT AMAZON BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Cavimom

customer_reviews.title: Cool features, crapped out quickly.
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited about this coffee maker when we first received it. The option to brew a single cup is awesome. HOWEVER we only used the carafe side about 6 times in 2 months and its already broken. Im very surprised considering the high reviews on this product. And now that 30 days have passed, I am unable to return it. I can only use the single cup side now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Started Leaking Within A Year
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I forgot to review this until now. Do yourself a favor and buy a different brand. The brew station started leaking and, after searching online for a remedy, I realized that this is a fairly normal thing that happens with Hamilton Beach. I will admit that it works great for the short time it actually does function correctly. You can take your chance since everyone's experience may differ; however, I greatly recommend you taking a pass on this product if you prefer your morning coffee in your cup as opposed to on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Great coffe maker... BUT the single serve side is useless.
customer_reviews.text: I'm from Colombia, so obviously a coffee lover and constant drinker. I love this coffee maker, it brews good tasty coffee, but just on the Carafe side. Unfortunately the Single Serve side doesn't work properly, it doesn't heat the water enough to make the coffee "cry" so yo just get dirty water. It is a shame and I'm really disappointed because I bought this brewer because of the Single Serve feature, and spent a lot of money bringing it to Colombia and buying the Perfect Pod Maker, for nothing because the single serve feature is useless for me. On the carafe side, it is a great coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Lugo

customer_reviews.title: 1 year after purchase
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this coffee maker a year or so ago from Amazon. I make one pot of coffee a day and it is still working BUT IT LOOKS TERRIBLE. After about 6 weeks the nonstick coating on the hot plate was completely worn off. It's all rust rust now. The hinged cover where the coffee grounds go has warped from the heat and has a 1/2" gap on the left side when closed. The lettering on the control buttons has worn of making them unreadable.
customer_reviews.author: Dan H

customer_reviews.title: It was a great decision to get this coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent coffee pot! I use both the single side for my travel cups, and the pot when I have company. You can control the quality so much better than with k-cups. It makes a very nice cup of coffee, and I love the Bold option and the programming function. Speaking of programming....this is definitely a slower coffee maker so using the programming function helps speed things up when you know you'll want your coffee. I love how easy it is to use, and especially how easy it is to clean. I would have given 5 stars except for the speed.
customer_reviews.author: Grymir

customer_reviews.title: Limited life - Works until it leaks!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased 3 of these coffee makers after doing research and based from reviews. Two were for gifts for family members and I personally kept one. We’ve had these for less than a year (Christmas 2017) and 2 of the 3 coffee makers’ reservoirs started leaking water. Each lasted about 9 months. The 3rd coffee maker that’s still working is used part time because they are still using a single serve K-cup quite often. We did like the coffee maker but for it not to last over a year is ridiculous. The other brand single serve coffee maker was simply retired when we bought this one and had it for over 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Springer

customer_reviews.title: Way better than a Keurig
customer_reviews.text: The biggest downfall of the Keurig is that it stores water when not in use which causes mold. Look up videos on YouTube it is disgusting. This unit you add water when you are making the coffee and it does not store the water making mold less likely (but not impossible). This is my second Hamilton Beach 2-Way Coffee maker. The versatility from a pot to single serve is amazing. I will continue to buy these in the future. I had my previous 2-Way coffee maker for several years with no problems, just upgrading to the new model which will look better in my kitchen (the old one was just black). Highly recommend, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JoeySperz

customer_reviews.title: Bought two of these. 1 year later they are terrible.
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about these and wanted to love them. But they simply don’t last. The water does not get hot enough and you end up with very weak coffee. I have tried everything I could think of to get a bolder cup of coffee (darker beans, bold brew setting, thinner grind, more coffee grounds) but none of works because the water simply does not come out hot enough. When using either unit I have to heat the coffee in the microwave after! Even though I love the design, I would not recommend purchasing one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Patience, for good coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, stylish, not too big and clunky, and makes a good cup/pot of coffee which is the most important part. My husband drinks decaf and I drink regular, so this is perfect for us as we can each have our own type of coffee and not have to use two separate coffee pots or wait for one of us to finish a pot before the other can have their coffee. The brewing time for the single cup is a bit of a wait, but not much longer than a standard Keurig. I like that the single cup brewer takes either regular grounds or pods.
customer_reviews.author: JE Hale

customer_reviews.title: The coffee maker did not last.
customer_reviews.text: I would fill in the coffee maker with ground coffee and water started falling to ione side ony thus it was not fully dischargin all the water I out into the deposit, coffee was not brewed properly due to this malfunction. I tored it away and will be putting it in the trash tomorrow. Yes I bought it months ago and used it only for 3 weeks until it went bad, I since bought another one Cuisinart Brew Central DCC-1200 and am quit happy with it. I am not buying this brand again!
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Solorzano

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Waste Your Time!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I’m disappointed. I expected rich, fragrant, quickly-brewed coffee. Both sides produced pale, lukewarm liquid. I doubt I’d have gotten scalded. The single-serve side dispensed the “coffee” into my awaiting mug in irregular spurts. The carafe side was no better, sputtering and squeezing out a disgusting, weak a**, watery brew. I feel I wasted some premium coffee in this machine that looks like a classy lady but is really a cheap wh$re.
customer_reviews.author: cs

customer_reviews.title: After a few months... not so good.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed perfect in the reviews. It was everything I could ask for in a coffee maker. Purchased it and everything worked and was delivered without issue. If I wrote the review then, it would have been 4 stars. Although, the single serve side is very week. After two months started to have problems with the slowness of the pump. Cleaned several times using various methods. Slightly improved, but still not okay. The pot side is now very weak. I'm just so bummed as I wanted this to work. The coffee maker is discontinued and for good reason. Message to Hamilton Beach... get back to the drawing board and make a better coffee maker. Great concept.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get coffee hot enough to my liking.
customer_reviews.text: I had a cheap coffee pot for several years that worked great. It got to where sometimes the coffee just didn't seem hot enough, so I searched for a good replacement and settled for this one after reading the reviews. I like the features it has, but it doesn't get the coffee as hot as my old one did on a bad day. I have to heat it up a bit more in the microwave, which is a pain. I should've bought another cheapo. If you like black coffee, it's probably ok, but if you add any cold creamer to it, it needs a little help.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Moore

customer_reviews.title: today I went to make my coffee and the coffeemaker sounds like it is going to explode and no water comes ...
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this in January. I use the single cup side every day for 1 cup of coffee, once in a while 2, today I went to make my coffee and the coffeemaker sounds like it is going to explode and no water comes out. I tried cleaning with vinegar and it does the same thing nothing comes out into the cup at all and it just makes a really loud gurgling sound like it is going to explode. Don't buy this, I'm extremely disappointed that I now have to start my search all over again after only a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Really like this coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Really like this coffee maker. I mostly make a cup or two per day. The beauty of this maker is I can control the strength to get the perfect cup for me every time. And, I am not adding to the plastic pollution of the earth. Going to buy the filter that Hamilton Beach sells do I don’t have to buy coffee filters. The single cup side comes with a filter and it is perfect. For our last drip pot we bought an off- brand filter and there was always coffee mud in the bottom of the pot, Hoping the HB filter for the “pot” portions works as well as the single side,
customer_reviews.author: HeelShields

customer_reviews.title: Great combination of brewing choices
customer_reviews.text: The brewer lets you brew one cup or an entire pot. Both methods produce great coffee. The single cup side has an adjustable stand for cups to travel mugs. You can even set the single-brewer timer to brew a single cup at a specific time. One caveat—this is not a K-cup machine. It uses coffee pods or ground coffee. It’s a little harder to find available blends in pods, but the ground coffee basket works well with coffee alone.
customer_reviews.author: G. M. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: So my boyfriend and I bought this coffee pot because we've outgrown our single serve Keurig and wanted to have the best of both worlds with our coffee. I was skeptical spending $60 on a coffee pot, but it's definitely worth it! I love the program feature and how easy it is to tell if it's activated or not and how to set the desired time. The coffee did come out tasting a little weird on our first pot, but it also might be us adjusting to having a full pot versus single serve 😂. Not so weird that we didn't drink it and hardly noticeable with creamer. 10/10 would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Kaylynn Green

customer_reviews.title: Coffee everywhere, again, because I add too much water
customer_reviews.text: I regret this purchase. No way to see the water level in the single cup, so several times now I've forgot that I've already added water and am left with coffee spilled all over my counter. The reservoir that the cup sits on does not catch any of the coffee, so not sure of it's purpose. I've used the single cup brew daily for a few months now. I brew several cups throughout the day and it functions properly. The coffee taste okay. Not as good as my last single cup coffee maker. No aroma of coffee being brewed. Haven't used the carafe.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Product
customer_reviews.text: We are 56 years old and have had many coffee makers we even bought a very expensive one that had an espresso press that we sent back years ago. I had a huge one from Italy in my salon. But for me privately at home this is by far the best coffee maker I have ever had. The convenience of making a single cup of coffee or a tall mug of coffee is exceptional and so is the coffee that it produces. I highly recommend this unit and disregard complaints, to me if they are complaining that means there was a malfunction and It can always be returned or replaced. This is a great machine!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lee and Tammy Guderian

customer_reviews.title: 3 Years Later......
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coffee maker back in 2017 and it has held up wonderfully. I mostly use the single-cup carafe and it is awesome. I only drink one cup of coffee in the morning so being able to brew just one cup saves me a lot of time in the morning while also limiting the number of coffee grounds used. As a result, this coffee maker has paid for itself with the amount of money it has saved me from buying coffee. I give this coffee maker my highest recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Favorite coffee pot ever
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality. The coffee tastes better than with my old brewer, and it takes a third less coffee to get the same strength, even on the normal setting (vs. bold). (And I like my coffee fairly strong, and the normal setting is just fine). The "by-the-cup" side works well with emptying just one teabag into the mesh basket to brew tea. The carafe side uses standard flat-bottom coffee filters that you can buy anywhere. The pot is large (12 cups) and pours really well and with no spillage (especially when initially pouring the water into the top of the coffee maker) due to its unique spout design. Definitely recommend this coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Humble correspondent

customer_reviews.title: Very nice; good coffee; not fancy but does the job
customer_reviews.text: I had a Ninja do-everything pot that broke down within a year. For $20, they sent me a new one. That also broke down; then started properly again; broke down, etc etc. I finally decided that it would like the garbage can better than my kitchen. So I bought this pot and it works great. Doesn't make iced coffee, but I know how to do that. Also doesn't make anything fancy which I generally don't make anyway. It makes strong or not strong coffee in 2 sizes. Anyway, this has taught me to forget about fancy schmancy and just buy what I need ---- a coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Clutter Hater

customer_reviews.title: Convient
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee pot. Many times I am the only one drinking coffee and I can make any single size coffee I want. I have a Kerig but you can only make a small cup or you have to run it through twice. With this coffee pot you put in the about of water (and coffee)you want and you get the amount of coffee you desire. The paperless filters are easy to clean. This pot is well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Mimi in Louisiana

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  4.5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: All I use is the single cup size so this is a limited review. I love using the Senseo pods but I also love using my loose ground coffee to mitigate the cost. I use two heaping teaspoons for a single serve 14 oz. The only "not too much a drawback" is that it takes about two minutes longer than my previous single cup coffee maker. So I adjusted - but I'd still prefer that it be faster. Other than that, I've had this coffee maker for over a year and it's been working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jean B. Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: garbage
customer_reviews.text: this machine is absolute garbage. I've tried both the carafe and single serve multiple times, using different water, different amounts of coffee, bold setting, regular setting, different coffee grinds, tried cleaning the machine, etc. Every time, its horrible coffee. It has no taste, doesn't brew the amount of water i put in, leaks, grinds end up in the cup. Any problem you can imagine having with a coffee maker, I've had with this. Returning it ASAP
customer_reviews.author: Tz

customer_reviews.title: It only lasted 7 months
customer_reviews.text: We loved this coffee maker. It worked great while it lasted. It was programable and made our coffee just the way we liked it. It's easy to clean and maintain. We unplugged it during the hurricanes and it was working great up until today. Then, this morning - no coffee. It wouldn't heat up. We bought it in March 2018 and it is dead in October 2018. We've never had a coffee maker stop working this quickly. Very unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: MutiRobyn

customer_reviews.title: Single served side failed within a year
customer_reviews.text: We loved this coffee pot, to the point that I would tell people at work about it since you can make single served coffee without a filter, and also make a full pot when the time requires. Yesterday, the single served side seems to have failed. It simply gurgles loudly, next to no water drips out, but steam comes out from the seams. I feared this thing was going to explode on me. Now, since it is relatively cheap and we do enjoy the flexibility, I purchased another to replace the failed one. I am only giving two stars though because I would have hopped for more than a single year.
customer_reviews.author: Brent F.

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when we needed a full coffee pot in the house, but I needed a k-cup machine also. That was a couple of years back, I think. It's still going strong, and never have had an issue with it at all! I can't say that about my last coffee pot, k-cup or not. I burn through post fast, as we drink a lot of coffee. My favorite part is the split brewer. I can make a travel mug and run out the door, or make a whole pot of coffee. And I don't need a lot of room on the counter
customer_reviews.author: Lynne B

customer_reviews.title: worst ever1
customer_reviews.text: Took this out of box...made 4 cups coffee not bad... Next day used the single cup...water did not flow down....tried the pot same thing happened....I believe this was defective....tried to reorder to no avail...not available. I have had hamilton beach pots for years...never a problem till this one. I should have realized something wrong when package came in in very poor condition,....had to go to staples and buy a Mr. coffee cheap...so I can have my coffee tomorrow morning....Dont buy this product...TERRIBLE!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: D. lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Machine
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I have always had a Keurig in the house. When our Keurig started acting up, we decided to switch to a conventional coffee pot. After doing lots of research, we decided to give this machine a try. We are so glad that we did! This coffee machine is super easy to use and looks so clean and modern when it sits on the kitchen counter. The coffee that it brews also takes great and very fresh! I have it programmed to make a pot every morning at 5:40 am. It’s so nice to come downstairs to a fresh brewed pot of coffee! This coffee pot is a life changer!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa T.

customer_reviews.title: Love it BUT.....
customer_reviews.text: So I was super excited to get this coffee maker cause we've been using our Keurig & Coffee Maker separately. First morning it brewed as programmed but I noticed the carafe glass was cracked. It cracked during first use. I was so disappointed however Amazon took care of me right away. I received the 2nd one and the top water reservoir lid was broken. So getting started with this particular model has been frustrating however we got it sorted out and everything is working fine. (fingers crossed) It's easy to use and looks great! I love waking up to the coffee already brewed!
customer_reviews.author: LO

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee maker. Both sides work exactly as expected. I haven't tried the pod attachment and that part seems pretty sketchy, just looking at it. It's obviously going to work, by switching back and forth with it would be a pain. But I bought this so I wouldn't have to use the expensive pods. And for that, this coffee maker is really fantastic. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: David Makin

customer_reviews.title: Jury is out.... not looking good.
customer_reviews.text: The Jury is out on this machine. The pot holds 12 cups of water. When I fill. the reservoir with the water from the pot, the water reaches the 12 cup line on the reservoir. I add coffee grounds in for 12 cups but when the coffee is done brewing, the coffee pot only has 10 cups of coffee in it. Some how .2 cups of water are being lost in the brew process. I am on my third pot of coffee. I believe the coffee may be brewing too hot. Since most people reviewed this machine favorably, I must have gotten a dud. I will repost after using the machine a while longer.
customer_reviews.author: AnneTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Single or 12 cup your choice.
customer_reviews.text: For a long time I was looking for a good coffee machine and I believe I just found it. I wanted to make enough just for me since my wife is not much of a coffee drinker but I would end up wasting more than I would drink. I never wanted those kuerick cup machine. With this I can make 1 cup or 12 so I normally just make single use one cup and then my wife does the same thing if she w to coffee. We can use the 12 cup when we have a lot of people over as well. Yes I will recommend this to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Ghost Zero

customer_reviews.title: Pretty machine, great single serve option
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - single cup serving works very well, no special cups or filters needed, just add coffee beans to the pre built in filter and you’re ready to go - coffee brews quickly - aesthetics are nice; it’s a pretty machine Cons: - the clock resets to 0:00 flashing if you unplug it or if the GCI switch turns the power off to that switch. I’ve gotten so tired of setting the clock, I’ve left it flashing 0:00 - no audible sound to alert you coffee is done. Several times I’ve forgotten I’ve brewed a single cup. This con is rather annoying as my precious Cuisinart maker would beep to let you know the coffee was done
customer_reviews.author: Rodzilla

customer_reviews.title: Set it and forget it!
customer_reviews.text: Nice coffeemaker. I purchased this one for a couple reasons. First was the ability to brew a pot or single cup. Amazing feature. The second reason was the ability to set the coffeemaker to start automatically at a designated time. It takes a couple minutes of prep the night before, but who doesn’t want to wake up to the smell of brewing coffee. Definitely makes it easier to get out of bed! No issues with this coffeemaker and I’ve had it for a year or two now.
customer_reviews.author: Vada

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: When it came time to getting a new coffee maker, my boyfriend suggested this one because of the dual function, the size of the carafe, and the ability to program it. This dual function is wonderful if only one of us needs coffee that morning rather than brewing a whole pot or on days we both need it first thing in the morning, we can program it the night before so we don’t have to think about it in the morning! Plus having the ability to make 12 cups of coffee at once is great for when we have company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Less than 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Four days shy of the one year purchase anniversary (not even the 1 year actual USE anniversary) , this coffee maker no longer makes coffee. I turned the brewer on at 6:00 AM, and two hours later, with about half of the water processed, it simply stopped working. Even our 'no frills' Mr Coffee lasted 5 years. It gets two stars because I liked it while it lasted, but I really hate having to get something new after 11.9 months. I do not recommend .
customer_reviews.author: Sean P Furey

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product unless you like grounds in your coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried everything to prevent grounds in my coffee. I make between 10-12 cups for my family in the morning and nothing has made a difference. I will never buy another Hamilton Beach coffee maker. I had this problem with the first one I owned, thinking it was just getting old, so I replaced it with the newest version of the same coffee maker. In retrospect, I should have just bought a different one entirely, which is what I'm going to do now. I"ve wasted a LOT of money.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee pot!
customer_reviews.text: I saw the bad reviews and almost did not order this and I’m so glad I did not listen. We got this to replace our Keurig because I did not like the waste, keurigs are notoriously difficult to keep clean and I work from home so I drink a lot of coffee and it just got to be ridiculous. Chose this one serve option along with the full pot option and we love it. We’ve had it for several months now and have not had any issues. It is well-made and the coffee tastes great.
customer_reviews.author: S. Dailey

customer_reviews.title: !!!FIRE HAZARD!!!
customer_reviews.text: In less than four months this coffee brewer started smoking and a strong odor of an electrical fire. The coffee maker was directly plugged into the outlet without any other appliances plugged into the outlet. I am thankful that I was home and awake.
customer_reviews.author: Louisianapilot

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 17 months
customer_reviews.text: I make less than an 8 cup pot daily. The coffee often had a funk to it and I had to clean it often. I got up today to make my daily pot. Pushed the button, which lit up, and no coffee. The pump and the heating element no longer work. I've had basic coffee pots that lasted for years.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee pot we've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Almost 30 years of marriage & almost as many coffee machines later, this one is the best one we've ever had! We've used it every single day for 2 years now & it's still working perfectly. Also, no dribble pot like many coffee machines come with. :)
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Christian

customer_reviews.title: Dead simple. Easy cleanup. Programmable!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my mornings. When I get home from work, I clean my travel mug, load the water into the coffee maker, scoop the coffee grounds, and press the program button. When I wake up, I have hot coffee ready to leave. I bang the reusable filter on the trash, give it rinse, and it's all set. On the weekends, the full pot works nicely too. This is all the convenience of a K-Cup without the price or environmental impact. Cannot recommend this enough! PS - My 16oz Contigo mug fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: TSchwen

customer_reviews.title: Nice coffee maker with a great single brew option
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is exactly what we needed. We’ve had it for about a month now and my husband and I are very please with it. The best part is the single cup part of the machine. I love that I can make a fresh cup of coffee in the middle of the day. The other thing I like about the coffee maker is the size. We don’t have a lot of counter space so I was worried about that, but once out of the box I was happy that it fit right in the same place as my old coffee maker. Overall I am very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Paulane

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive Ad
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware! Okay, it is my fault for not reading the full description; but I was replacing a brewer of the same model and was very familiar with it. However, the photo shows the Travel Mug which came with my original one but no so with the one I just received. I was upset and went back to the purchase and sure enough in parenthesis it stated "travel mug not included". Shame on Amazon, show the photo without the travel mug.
customer_reviews.author: D. Harwood

customer_reviews.title: My long lost love
customer_reviews.text: I broke my basic coffee pot . It was horrible and sad day. I turned to Amazon for help. Wow ! What do you know sits this in expensive and 2 way coffee maker . Read reviews , googled other stores for prices , and set my mind on this one . I have attached a video as well first ever of my friend. I can now have a single serve cup quickly on the go , or make up to 10 cups ( that’s a lot of coffee) . The single serve comes with the filter no need to buy any others , just your normal ones. Excellent purchase !!! Thanks Amazon for hooking me up.
customer_reviews.author: Floatingegg

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Great
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful implementation of one-cup or whole-pot options. Tiny beef with the one-cup brewer when using the single scoop at both the minimum fill and maximum fill for regular ground coffee. There's no combo I've found that will prevent lots of grounds ending up in the coffee cup. Full pot option works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Masterhoda

customer_reviews.title: Single serve side reservoir leaks but Amazon saves the day
customer_reviews.text: We've had this coffee maker for three days. The single serve side leaks after we put water in the reservoir...a constant trickle from a seam in the appliance. Unusable. We are chronically unlucky with appliances!!!! The bright side is that Amazon's customer service is delightful and helpful compared to Hamilton Beach! A new machine will be here on Monday and we'll send the leaky one back to Amazon at their expense instead of cutting the cord and throwing the appliance away as H B wanted us to do. Thank you, Amazon, for having such great customer service. I can continue to buy from you with peace of mind!
customer_reviews.author: K. A. C.

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Bought this due to review average and the fact that it is an Amazon Choice product. Not at all happy. I actually bought it TWICE. Ugh. Love the price, and the concept, with the single serve option and timer. Those options are great, if only the darn thing worked longer than 8 months. So if you are happy with a product that works for a short time, this is for you. Also...they use special screws that are NOT compatible with either flathead or Phillips screwdrivers, so I can't even take it apart to fix it's faulty engineering. 1 star. My recommendation: DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Deatherage

customer_reviews.title: Never using a Keurig again!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I purchased this device after our 7 year old Keurig bit the dust. After a few weeks of owning this device I decided I will never go back to a Keurig! The single cup serving unit takes a few tries to get used to. If you fill it up too much, you'll get coffee grounds in your cup. Other than that, once you've master the single serve, you'll be enjoying fresher, better tasting, and cheaper coffee every single morning. I purchased the permanent filter that is recommended with this product and am glad I did. I've only used paper filters, and didn't realize how convenient and easy to clean a permanent filter is.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha Lea

customer_reviews.title: I dont know if they sent a previously returned coffee maker or what happened but I am very disappointed with this product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter and when she tried to use it the single serving cup side worked perfectly. She tried to use the full pot side and when she poured water into the back the water leaked out from every place possible. the whole pot of water pored out all over the counter and continued to leak out the bottom and even got into where the clock is. On top of that the togo cup that is supposed to come with the coffee maker was missing. I dont know if they sent a previously returned coffee maker or what happened but I am very disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie R.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is, by far, the WORST coffeemaker I have ever owned. The flavor of the coffe it brews is horrible. You lose 25-30% of the volume of water to steam. The coffee pods are weak. I am very sorry I purchased this unit because I was trying to save a few bucks. I am currently attempting to preemptively, and intentionally, kill this unit so I can get a different one. I am NOT complaining about the processing of the order at all. Consider a different unit.
customer_reviews.author: Tait Klein

customer_reviews.title: Durability issues
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased this item twice and both times the machine began to fail within a year’s time after daily use. Something seems to go wrong with the percolation process, where not all of the water is used from the reservoir no matter how much time is allowed; during percolation there’s nearly constant gurgling and lots of steam, but maybe half of the water ends up in the pot. This is after thorough cleaning, vinegar, etc. to make sure the process is not being interrupted due to debris. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ECMWF

customer_reviews.title: I love this coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: And on the eighth day God said "Let them drink coffee! And he proceeded to give man the Hamilton Beach Single Serve Coffee Maker!" I know I know that isn't exactly canon but you get my point. I love this coffee maker! How many cups do you want? 12? Done! Oh you only want 1 cup and need it quick, fast and in a hurry!? Done! Oh you want a stronger brew!? Done! Oh you need this little beauty to make coffee at exactly 7:00 A.M. on the dot!? Done! What more do you want it to do!? Taxes maybe..... Fantastic coffee pot and the price is very budget friendly!
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Single cup sett up makes no sense
customer_reviews.text: The setup for the single cup setting is bizarre. Instead of drawing from the main water reservoir you have to pour the water in separately. The way it sets up to hold a mug versus a travel mug is flimsy. stacked plastic cups - they don't even clip in. I got this maker after my Ninja coffee maker died and it's no where near as useful.
customer_reviews.author: Paisley Lunchick

customer_reviews.title: I figured out how to use this amazing coffee maker correctly
customer_reviews.text: After initial "user error", I figured out how to use this amazing coffee maker correctly. 'Doh' on me, as I truly should have read the directions. For those of you who like to use fresh beans every day, make sure you don't grind too fine when using this machine, or the water will have a more difficult time going through it...you'll end up with water overflow and grounds in your carafe/mug. I've used both the single serve function, & most often the carafe function. Both make incredibly awesome tasting coffee! Great for either pre-ground or fresh ground coffee. I'm extremely happy with this new coffee maker!
customer_reviews.author: J. Munafo

customer_reviews.title: Broken on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Carafe broken on arrival. Amazon ordered full replacement instead of sending a carafe only. Returning a product is a hassle. (1 star) It's a coffee maker. Nothing special. - Water reservoir is plastic(3 star). - Carafe is glass (4 stars). - Reasonable price $60 (5 star). - Control buttons are not intuitive (2 star). - Design? ok (4 star).
customer_reviews.author: EricAllen

customer_reviews.title: ... this coffee maker for over a year now and LOVE it! I have used this EVERY SINGLE DAY ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this coffee maker for over a year now and LOVE it! I have used this EVERY SINGLE DAY for the past year, at least the smaller side, and for the most part the pot side as well and I have had no issues with it. I like being able to set the alarm and have my coffee ready when I wake up. My only complaint is that the plastic on the lid of the coffee maker has worn over time and I have to hold my hand/thumb over it to keep the coffee from pouring out all at once.
customer_reviews.author: justanotherreader

customer_reviews.title: Great for all of my coffee needs (which is alot)
customer_reviews.text: I love this because I can set it for a cup and still have a separate side ready for when my family stops by later in the day. Just flip a switch and press a button and boom more coffee. I wish I would have found this before. I should have bought the one with a filter! Next time!!!
customer_reviews.author: Karla N La Bella

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for personal or work use
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my teacher work room (me and another teacher use it daily). It is so easy to use the main carafe or the single use compartment. It isn’t compatible with Keurig cups but is a basket for single serving coffee grounds (think mini version of a basket for the main carafe). I really like that, because I didn’t want to HAVE to but Keurig cups (too much waste). The programs and settings are easy to use. The overflow tray for the single use section is deep and easy to clean as well. I am very pleased that I found this and can use it with my fellow colleagues.
customer_reviews.author: JesSica

customer_reviews.title: Great carafe design
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! Had this about a month, so I can't really comment on durability. The carafe design is great! You can actually fill the water reservoir without spilling water everywhere. Wife submits that a woman engineer likely designed it. The heat plate is recessed into the frame, so you have to look at what you're doing when returning the carafe to the heat plate. Really simple operation, just read the instructions and it works as advertised. Single cup function works great with loose coffee, but I haven't really tried any pods with it. K-cup style pods would NOT work with this model. Overall, 5 big stars. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: ja69

customer_reviews.title: "Ok" coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted the Ninja coffee bar that makes either 1 cup or a whole pot. BUT I didn't want to spend the money... so I found this and decided to try it. It's "ok". It is nice to have the single cup feature, however it only makes up to a 14 oz cup- so if you are making a to-go travel mug, you likely won't get a full cup. The programmable features were easy to figure out, and and full pot side is good. All in all, I wish I had spent the money on the Ninja
customer_reviews.author: P.P.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and versatile
customer_reviews.text: Used as a single cup maker 99% of the time. Really like being able to use my own coffee beans freshly ground before I make the coffee for a single cup at a time. I like Kuerig fine but enjoy going after unique blends of coffee beans and going fresh ground. Unit has a nice profile if not a little big on the counter but I don't know how you'd get smaller and offer full pot and single cup options. Easy to clean between cups, Seems well enough made and so far no problems at all. Just what I was looking for and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: PBD

customer_reviews.title: Carafe broken in less than 2 years - can't replace
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in July 2019. By September 2020, the carafe was no longer functioning properly (it was spilling coffee on the machine). We wanted to replace it and the replacement carafe is out of stock/not available. Other model carafes are available but not this one. So we're stuck using the one-cup side, until we can get a new coffee pot. Not the greatest investment.
customer_reviews.author: Denise G

customer_reviews.title: Water not hot enough.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the setup of this machine. The single cup or pot is the reason we bought it, but the coffee it brews does not taste good. It has a very bland taste to it. It's the same coffee and amount per pot we've been using for years, it just doesn't taste good out of this machine. As some other reviewers have said, it doesn't get the water hot enough, which is my guess for why it tastes this way. The water coming out of the spout into the grounds is only around 175°F. We're returning it.
customer_reviews.author: KPD

customer_reviews.title: Adequate
customer_reviews.text: Haven't actually used this since I bought it because I only use my moka pot. But ex wife and I had this one and used it regularly and I loved it. The side cup thing is great if you just want one cup. I was always good about keeping it clean so in the 3 years we used it we never experienced issues. Still don't know if I'm ever actually going to use this so I might give it away idk. If you're buying this it's because you use preground coffee and value convenience over a quality beverage.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Nice coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: Great coffee maker. I love that the single serving comes with a reusable strainer or you can use k cups. The other side doesnt so I had to buy the one Amazon reccomends and that fits well. Fyi the single serving side is slower than a Keurig to make coffee, but I dont mind that. Just be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: but for me I don't like that your only options are a single serve or ...
customer_reviews.text: There is not anything really wrong with this product, but for me I don't like that your only options are a single serve or a full pot of coffee. I would like the option to do maybe 4 cups of coffee. It is nice because you can do just a hot cup of hot water if you're making hot chocolate or tea. I noticed some of the other coffee makers only give you the option for hot water and not a single cup of coffee but they look the same as this machine, it is deceiving unless you read the description.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Everytime!
customer_reviews.text: I was nicely surprised when I got this coffe maker. It has separate timers for single cup and caraffe. My roommate works early and just sets the cup portion; while I am home in the morning and make my own. Auto feature turns pot off after 2 hours. While brewing, the clock lights up blue. Nice feature. Also has a "Bold" setting forSLOW Brewed coffee. Ive found the coffe nice and bold just on regular setting and takes a quarter of the time. I use a Columbian Dark Blend. On the downside, a permanent brass type filter was included but not so for the caraffe side. Otherwise 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Rev Mike Lawlor

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean; gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this coffee pot to take over the place of my Keurig. The keurig was nice, but it got dirty soooo quick and made the coffee taste disgusting. Plus, it would only brew one cup at a time. This coffee pot is AWESOME. It keeps the coffee super hot, can make up to 12 cups of coffee, is programmable, easy to use, easy to clean, etc. The pros of this coffee maker outweighs the cons for sure. I would say the only con is that I do find a lot of coffee grounds in my coffee.
customer_reviews.author: LiAnn Seale

customer_reviews.title: Great quality worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this coffee maker. It came with the copper insert for the single-serve and the copper insert that I had for regular carafe coffee fits perfectly inside. It's easy to use, and it gives you the exact amount of coffee you ask for. It's clean and sleek-looking and fit perfectly in my kitchen. I would highly recommend this dual coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Michaud

customer_reviews.title: So Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I totally love this coffee maker! In my house my son likes his flavored coffee, but me and my other son like our regular coffee, so when my oldest wants his flavored coffee in the morning and i have already brewed a pot of coffee, he will brew a single serve for himself. or vice versa. it great when in the evenings i just want a cup of coffee, i dont have to make a whole pot. and the bold brew option is great because if someone wants a stronger brew, it just a matter of pressing a button!
customer_reviews.author: K. D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: It's a mediocre product. It'll probably brew coffee, but it will definitely leak.
customer_reviews.text: Meh. It makes coffee. It leaks. It was ok for a while. Couldn't put water in the night before and program it to brew in the morning, because it would leak all over the kitchen during the night. It did its job, but there were cheaper models available. We got this one so we could program it, and it turned out we couldn't use it that way, which was frustrating. Now it leaks so fast we can't even brew a pot before it starts peeing all over the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Not Keurig Cup Compatible
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this coffee maker. I don't remember reading that it was not K-cup compatible in the description, but that may have just been me. It does have a single cup basket that says it holds pods, but it doesn't have the needles needed to poke holes in the K-cup. I just cut mine open and pour into the basket filter. I also use the carafe side regularly. All-around good deal for people who have the need for both kinds of coffee-making.
customer_reviews.author: styxx374

customer_reviews.title: Great machine - I'm pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Love this unit and how it has two compartments for single serve and full. Looks nice, does what it is supposed to - brew great coffee. Just a tweak (and this goes for all electronic devices on the market) - would be nice if there was an "off" switch for the blue LED screen once it starts brewing. It can get bright. It is off all of the other times, but it would be great if we could manually turn it off, especially if we have the unit in our sleeping quarters. Again, that's only a tweak and most people don't sleep near their coffee machines. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the programmable brew time!
customer_reviews.text: I love the that we can program a time for the coffee to brew. It’s great to wake up to coffee ready to go. I wish it had a reusable filter for the carafe side. That would probably be the only thing I would change. Coffee stay nice and hot too. The single cup brew works great too. Haven’t tried the little pods in it yet, just the filter. Definitely would recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Katie L

customer_reviews.title: Was so excited !
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews I was a little worried, but I have been using it for a couple of days and I have to say that I love it very much and it's been over all better then some of the other coffee makers I have used, I do wish that they would offer the option to buy a extra single serve filter that would be even better,but other than that I just want to say I love my Hamilton coffee pot and I am a true coffee drinker,and it's perfect I can brew a single cup for on the road when I have to run out of the house,
customer_reviews.author: Crystal StPierre

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker!
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee maker! Bought it so could have a pot of caffeinated coffee and could make some decaf for my mother on the side. You can't make both sides at the same time but that isn't a problem for me. Makes great coffee, fabulous taste, nice and hot. I have had no problem with this unit at all! Love the clear buttons; There is a slide switch to change it from making coffee on the pot versus making a travel mug of coffee. It doesn't come with the travel mug so have a tall one handy for the machine. It's a no-brainer to use. Will buy it again if this one ever breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Vitagirl

customer_reviews.title: You have to use good water and good coffee - true with any coffeemaker!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter gave us this for Christmas and I love it. I like having a fresh cup of coffee right away because I am up earlier, and then making a pot for both my husband and me later. It brews very good coffee IF you use the right coffee and good water (this is so with any coffeemaker). The added bonus of being able to have a single cup any time, and even a cup of decaf to keep from getting too much caffeine, makes this coffeemaker a great choice for us! So glad my daughter thought of it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really Happy With This Purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Great coffee, easy cleanup, easy to use, and it looks great. A permanent filter for the carafe side is a great accessory. I'm not a huge coffee drinker and I don't do day old coffee, so this lets me make a cup when I want without waste yet be able to make a pot when company comes over. I do regret not getting a model that could use K-cups, I didn't realize how limited the selection in "pods" was. Still, that's my fault and not the coffee maker. It does exactly what it says it does and does it well. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Casey O

customer_reviews.title: No muscle
customer_reviews.text: Having an option to brew a cup or a pot is nice, as is the auto shutdown after 2 hours and theoretical choice of Brew Options. In practice, it produces satisfying flavor ONLY if I use considerably more coffee than instructed, i.e. a heaping 1/3 cup of grounds for “3” cups—a mug of coffee—and choose the Bold option—and use two filters instead of one. This has not been an issue with other coffee makers. I wonder if the engineer who designed this model was actually a tea drinker.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee pot, doesn’t use k-cups
customer_reviews.text: Such a nice coffee maker! All the best parts of any coffee maker. Just be aware it doesn’t fit k-cups so if this model is one you’re looking to buy and want to use k cups get a different one, this has a reusable coffee filter for the single serve which I love. And you can set a timer for both the single serve and the coffee pot. They make pods for these you can get instead of a k-cup (which waste plastic and aren’t reusable anyway)
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: Coffee maker grace
customer_reviews.text: This is one of many coffee makers in our home. This was a suggested purchased by me for my husband. It definitely looks great on our kitchen counter in our beverage area. It is used frequently. I personally love the single cup feature on this particular coffee maker. I would also recommend the purchase. However, cleaning can be a little exhausting!
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Not efficient
customer_reviews.text: It seemed like a nice unit upon looking at it online however it’s completely plastic! Cheap looking/ feeling plastic at that. The whole pot function is fine and does it’s job however the single serve side takes forever to do just one cup of coffee. It comes out in the thinnest, slowest stream imaginable. I could’ve brewed 6 cups in it’s time to do 1. I would return it if I haven’t already used it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: So this is probably one of my favorite coffee makers
customer_reviews.text: So this is probably one of my favorite coffee makers. I have a chemex, aeropress, v60's, i've gone through 3 Kurigs, but this one is probably the best for lazy Sunday mornings when you set the timer and it's ready when you finally crawl out of bed. The other ones I mentioned are great for coffee I want to extract perfectly, but this does a decent job at that too. Still really happy with it =]
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Bartley

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy if your wanting to use the single serve function and the automatic programming
customer_reviews.text: What I dislike about this coffee maker is the time it takes to brew. It is slow and the single cup is honestly worthless. Not to be harsh but it is messy and coffee grounds in the coffee. The coffee pot itself is ok but I bought it to set timer night before and that doesn’t program rt! I have to just prep/fill up everything the night before and push start button first thing. Will not automatically start at time set. You manually have to start power button. I actually just prefer my keurig
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good cup of coffee at a reasonable price with reservations
customer_reviews.text: Makes a good cup of coffee at a reasonable price. I have used for about eight months now but only the carafe side. A couple of gripes which drop my rating. First, it drips a drop or three when I remove the carafe during brewing more than half the time. Second, when putting the carafe back in it has to be forced in. I think the shutoff valve/spring/assembly must be a bit out of spec.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Coffeemaker 4 my house
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with my new coffeemaker. I love I can make coffe for just me or a pot for a gathering. Or if someone wants something different than coffee. I'm very pleased that I found this coffee maker
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Makes nice strong coffee which is an absolute must.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a few months and haven’t had an issue yet. After having nothing but problems with my ninja, I was worried about finding something that actually works well. This is doing the job so far. We’ll see how it is for the next year. Simple interface which seems like the best bet. I set the timer for my travel mug for work everyday, and also prepare the carafe side the night prior for my girlfriend to start when she wakes up. Makes nice strong coffee which is an absolute must.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bogues

customer_reviews.title: Great value, love the single serve side!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice coffee maker for the money. It brews fairly slow on the "bold" setting. It took about 13 minutes to brew a full pot, but the taste was great. The single serve side is excellent, much better than using a pod, the filter is quite large so you can make a very strong mug of coffee if you'd like. My only criticism is the coffee does not seem too hot, but I think it's hot enough. My old Cuisinart (which finally died after about 20 years!) brewed hotter.
customer_reviews.author: PFraserTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Amazons great customer service
customer_reviews.text: The first celery of this coffee machine had a broken carafe, as it was around the holidays I was expecting a delay in its replacement. Amazon shipped a replacement out within a day. Having the single cup option or full pot option is great; the fact that even the single cup is programmable if convenient for when I have an earlier morning than my partner. No one gets cold coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Leena

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee pot for a year, then it failed.
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is even better than units that cost twice the price, but mine failed just outside of warranty. It still made coffee, but the water reservoir leaked all over the counter top, every time. I reached out to Hamilton beach to see if there was an easy fix as I found this to be common, all they offered was a coupon for 10% off a new one. Had it not leaked 100%, I would say it's the best coffee maker out there.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Slower than a monday at work
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is slower than 96 year old granda putting on socks. It makes coffee so I'll give them that. If you want a pot of coffee when you wake up, you better use the program to start your brew 30 min before you wake up. Brand new out of the box it takes 27 minutes to brew a 12 cup pot. This is cheap junk. I'd buy a 19.99 black and decker before I ever considered this. Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: PerezScott

customer_reviews.title: A great product diminished to a simple good one due to its mediocre durability
customer_reviews.text: It's a very good product when it was working. It has a very common problem with today's devices: they don't last. It was great all this time but it barely lasted for little more than a year. It is very upsetting.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon Abreu

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach 2-Way Brewer Coffee Maker, Single-Serve and 12-Cup Pot, Stainless Steel (49980A), Carafe
product_meta.description: For all the coffee drinkers and aficionados in search of an affordable, low maintenance coffee maker that can brew a basic or premium roast coffee in a fraction of the time and cost as the coffee house: Meet the Hamilton Beach 2-Way Brewer. Voltage 110 volts. The 2-Way Brewer unit will only brew one side at a time. For a particular preference, simply switch the lever left or right. Any soft pod coffee brand, available in the coffee aisle of your local grocery store, or any loose coffee grounds can be used. The 2-Way Brewer is not compatible with the K-Cup pack.
feature_bullets: Brew two ways: Enjoy either a single-serve cup (travel mug not included) or full pot of coffee with the 12-cup carafe.
Fully programmable: Wake up to a hot cup of coffee with fully programmable functionality and auto-shutoff.
Adjusts to your cup: Can brew directly into the carafe, a travel mug (not included) or a short cup(not included)
Convenient single-serve: Brew a cup for one using loose, ground coffee.
Smart features: Includes brew strength selector (regular or bold), keep-hot warming plate and more.
Note: Travel mug or cup not included
